subject: Re: How to comment test methods in Junit 4?
msgSnippet: If we are not able to comment our test methods in suite, we have scroll our Test case from top to bottom to comment each test method using @Ignore, this is not
messageBody:
If we are not able to comment our test methods in suite, we have
scroll our Test case from top to bottom to comment each test method
using @Ignore, this is not the right solution.

When Junit3.8 supports this, Junit4 must be having a way to do this.

Thanks.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Ilja Preuss" <preuss@...> wrote:
>
> Why do you want to do it "old style"?
>
> Curious, Ilja
>
> junit@yahoogroups.com wrote:
> > Can anybody help me on how to solve this?
> >
> > Thanks.
> >
> >
> > --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "vgreddy43" <vgreddy43@> wrote:
> >>
> >> Hello friends,
> >>
> >> I have a test case with some testmethods which are written in
> >> junit 4 style. As showsn below.
> >>
> >> public Class MyTestCase{
> >>
> >> @Before
> >> public void mysetup(){
> >> //some code
> >> }
> >>
> >> @Test
> >> public void mytest1(){
> >> //some code
> >> }
> >>
> >> @Test
> >> public void mytest2(){
> >> //some code
> >> }
> >>
> >> @After
> >>
> >> public void myteardown(){
> >> //some code
> >> }
> >>
> >> public static junit.framework.Test suite() {
> >> return new JUnit4TestAdapter(MyTestCase.class);
> >> }
> >>
> >> When we run this it will test mytest1 and mytest2 methods. But
if I
> >> want only mytest1 to run how do I do that. Using @Ignore we
> >> can comment other tests but I want to do this in junit3.8
style, like
> >>
> >> Public static Test suite() {
> >> TestSuite suite = new TestSuite("TestSuite"); suite.addTest(new
> >> MyTestCase("mytest1")); //suite.addTest(new
> >> OIDBHelperTest("myttest2")); //suite.addTest(new
> >> OIDBHelperTest("myttest3"));
> >>
> >> return suite;
> >> }
> >>
> >> Any ideas on this, how to acheive this type of functionality in
> >> junit4?
> >>
> >> thanks.
> >>
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
